content.description:
Travis is striding briskly across Broadway toward the Palantine Headquarters.He's dressed the best we have seen him; his pants (not jeans) are pressed,
 his boots shined, his hair combed. Under his Army jacket he wears a freshly laundered shirt and ivy league tie. He drops his cigarette, steps on it and walks in.
 Watching Travis enter Palantine's Headquarters, we are surprised to realize that Travis is really quite attractive. His deformities are psychological, not physical. He believes he is cursed, and therefore he is.
Travis walks briskly into the office, and heads toward Betsy's desk.  Tom walks over to greet him, but Travis ignores him.
As the CAMERA examines Travis' face more closely, one can see the hollowness wrought by lack of sleep and sufficient diet.
BETSY waves TOM off with a short gesture, indicating everything is OK.  He walks away.
Betsy is interviewing Travis, but she is also teasing him a little, leading him on in a gentle feminine way.
Travis is pacing back and forth on Broadway just beyond the Palantine Headquarters. He checks his watch.
content.dialogues:
TRAVIS (V.O.):I had black coffee and apple pie with a slice of melted yellow cheese.
00:23:42,797 --> 00:23:47,383
 I think that was a good selection.
00:23:47,593 --> 00:23:49,844
Betsy had coffee and a fruit salad dish.
 00:23:50,054 --> 00:23:52,388
 She could've had anything she wanted.
00:23:54,725 --> 00:23:57,435

BETSY:Fifteen thousand volunteers in New York alone's not bad.
00:23:54,725 --> 00:23:57,435
But the organizational problems.
00:23:57,686 --> 00:23:59,479
TRAVIS:Yes, I know what you mean. I've got the same problems.
00:24:01,565 --> 00:24:04,609
I gotta get organized. Little things, like my apartment, my possessions.
00:24:04,860 --> 00:24:09,906
I should get one of those signs that says, 'One of these days I'm Gonna Organiz-zed.'
00:24:10,699 --> 00:24:14,536

BETSY: You mean "organized"?
00:24:14,787 --> 00:24:16,412

TRAVIS: Organiz-ized.
00:24:16,622 --> 00:24:18,498
Organiz-ized. It's a joke.
00:24:18,749 --> 00:24:21,167
O-R-G-A-N-E-Z-I-E-Z-D
00:24:22,044 --> 00:24:24,629

BETSY:You mean "organiz-ize." Like those little signs in offices that say, "Thimk."
00:24:24,880 --> 00:24:29,134

TRAVIS:Do you like where you work?
00:24:35,307 --> 00:24:36,724

BETSY: We've got some good people. And I think Palantine's got a good chance.
00:24:38,144 --> 00:24:42,063

TRAVIS:You know you have beautiful eyes?
00:24:46,193 --> 00:24:48,278
Do you like the guy you work with?
00:24:54,869 --> 00:24:56,953

BETSY: He's okay.
00:24:57,204 --> 00:24:58,788

TRAVIS:Yeah, I know.But do you like him?
00:25:00,457 --> 00:25:02,041

BETSY: He's funny, good at his job. He's okay. Though he does have a few problems.
00:25:02,543 --> 00:25:07,005

TRAVIS: I would say he has quite a few problems.
00:25:07,214 --> 00:25:09,382
His energy seems to go in the wrong places.
00:25:11,135 --> 00:25:14,179
When I walked in and I saw you two sitting there...
00:25:14,805 --> 00:25:17,599
...I could just tell that there was no connection...
00:25:17,808 --> 00:25:20,685
...whatsoever.
00:25:20,895 --> 00:25:22,270
And I felt when I walked in, there was something between us.
00:25:22,521 --> 00:25:25,732
There was an impulse that we were both following.
00:25:25,983 --> 00:25:28,651
So that gave me the right to talk to you.
00:25:28,903 --> 00:25:31,571
Otherwise, I never would've felt that I had the right to talk to you.
00:25:31,780 --> 00:25:35,533
I never would've had the courage to talk to you.
00:25:35,784 --> 00:25:38,745
And with him, I felt there was nothing.
00:25:39,663 --> 00:25:42,123
When I walked in, I knew I was right.Did you feel that way?
00:25:42,333 --> 00:25:45,418

BETSY:I wouldn't be here if I didn't.
00:25:49,006 --> 00:25:51,299

TRAVIS:Where are you from?
00:25:53,636 --> 00:25:54,886

BETSY:Upstate.
00:25:55,471 --> 00:25:56,596

TRAVIS:That fellow, I don't like him.
00:26:00,684 --> 00:26:02,310
Not that I don't like him,I just think he's silly.
00:26:02,519 --> 00:26:05,521
I don't think he respects you.
00:26:07,983 --> 00:26:10,235

BETSY:I don't believe I've ever met anyone quite like you.
00:26:11,362 --> 00:26:14,489

TRAVIS:You wanna go to...
00:26:25,834 --> 00:26:27,543
...a movie with me?
00:26:28,879 --> 00:26:30,546

BETSY:I have to go back to work now.
00:26:31,090 --> 00:26:35,051

TRAVIS:I don't mean now. Another time?
00:26:31,090 --> 00:26:35,051
